message.content:
cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.CG, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with coreset constructions, which are a topic in computational geometry and machine learning. Specifically, the paper discusses coreset constructions for clustering problems, which are a common topic in machine learning. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with geometric spaces, so cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses techniques for converting offline coreset constructions to the streaming setting, which involves compressing data, so cs.IT (Information Theory) is a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with handling outliers, which is a topic in statistics and data analysis, so cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a possible sub-category.
